content:
Diagnosis:	Metastatic sigmoid adenocarcinoma, MMR proficient, HER2 negative

Management:	15 Jan 2024 Emergency laparotomy - peritoneal disease noted
		1 Feb 2024 Started FOLFOX chemotherapy
		15 Mar 2024 Cycle 3 discontinued due to progressive disease

Histology:	Moderately differentiated adenocarcinoma with peritoneal involvement

Current Situation:	Progressive disease following 3 cycles FOLFOX

I reviewed [redacted name] today following recent CT showing disease progression. Unfortunately, there has been significant clinical deterioration with increasing abdominal pain and ascites requiring two paracenteses in the past month. Performance status has declined to ECOG 3. Recent CT on 20/3/24 confirms progression of peritoneal disease with new omental cake and moderate volume ascites. There is also new small volume liver disease in segments 4 and 8.

Blood results show rising CEA from 45 to 180 over 6 weeks. Albumin has dropped to 28. Other liver function tests show mild derangement with ALP 345 and ALT 65.

Given the rapid progression through first-line chemotherapy and declining performance status, we had a detailed discussion about prognosis and goals of care. [redacted name] understands that further systemic therapy carries significant risks with limited chance of benefit. We have agreed to focus on symptom management with early palliative care involvement.

I have referred to the palliative care team and arranged weekly paracentesis as needed. We will review in 2 weeks with repeat bloods. I have provided emergency contact details and arranged district nurse support.
